You like Valve's comedy? You like physics puzzles? You like bunnyhopping on the Source engine? So do I. That's why I recommend Portal.

Nonostante i numerosi difetti come la boss fight finale o come la scarsa longevitÃ , Portal ancora oggi rimane una piccola perla allo stato grezzo. Nonostante, a mio parere, non si stia parlando di un capolavoro, Portal anche dopo anni resta unico nel suo genere. 
Consigliato particolarmente agli amanti dei Puzzle Games e a coloro che vorrebbero seguire la storia della saga di Portal dagli albori senza perdersi nessun dettaglio.

Portal, for it's time, was a really odd and bold choice of a game concept. To put it short, it's a single-player 3D puzzle game that relies on critical thinking and slight quick reaction timing (along with fps skills). The puzzles within portal are usually short, but long enough to be enjoyed by any casual player. They aren't too hard to the point where it's not enjoyable, but not too easy so that it makes the game look like it was for 3 year olds. The puzzles rely on the use of a weapon/utility known as the portal gun. It makes black holes/portals that you can walk through to get from point A to point B in an instant. This was/still is a fun concept that was added to puzzling games. The feeling and humor of the game is an enjoyable satire-esque feel, so be prepared to enter a more suggestible state! Over all, I'd give the game a [u][b]10/10[/b][/u] for a memorable story, enjoyable concept and humor, and for being a good puzzle game. It is definitely worth every cent.

Un juego breve pero mÃ¡s que interesante, una pequeÃ±a obra de arte que viene en la medida justa para sacar risas y entretener, dejando varios interrogantes que la misma comunidad va llenando a su modo. Posee algo que escasea en el medio: Una historia bien contada, aunque sea una corta.
Los puzzles tienen el nivel suficiente para hacer pensar mÃ¡s no para frustrarse frente a la pantalla y no llegan a ser tantos como para uno aburrirse. 

QuizÃ¡ un juego obligatorio para los amantes de los videojuegos que deseen probar cosas nuevas e innovadoras. (AÃºn despuÃ©s de tantos aÃ±os, creo que lo sigue siendo).

ComeÃ§ando pelo enredo que te prende do comeÃ§o ao fim com apenas dois personagens, sendo vocÃª a â€œChellâ€ e sua inimiga â€œGLaDOSâ€ ("Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System"; em portuguÃªs, "Forma de vida GenÃ©tica e Sistema Operacional em Disco"). VocÃª acorda em um dormitÃ³rio com paredes transparente dentro de uma sala de testes e ouve uma voz de passando orientaÃ§Ãµes e coordenados para participar de um teste.

O jogo Ã© focado em puzzles e Ã© preciso raciocino lÃ³gico, vocÃª tem uma arma que dispara dois portais, sendo um azul e outro laranja que permite vocÃª entrar dentro deles e ser tele portado entre eles, um excelente conceito. Alguns dos puzzles sÃ£o bem divertidos de resolver e outros sÃ£o bem difÃ­ceis, porÃ©m nÃ£o impossÃ­vel, basta manter a calma, respirar e analisar as possibilidades que vocÃª vai conseguir.

Outro ponto que merece destaque Ã© que o jogo tem legenda PortuguÃªs e sempre entre em promoÃ§Ãµes sendo uma delas de 90% de desconto deixando o game valendo R$ 1,99 Ã© praticamente de graÃ§a.

ä¸é”™

Shortal, a Valve video game.
This is like Half-Life 2, but only puzzles. Just puzzles. It does smell very 2007 because there is a boss fight.
No graphical improvments since HL2 or any magical catchy music. You actually dont need it here. Puzzles do make you think abit. alright. But, since its a Valve FP-based game, you'll have typical issues like being too fat to crawl below obvious things or not having hands to grab onto a ledge. Ending sequence is also abit too long, could've made it shorter. Glados mockery is great but more backstory would be nice. Oh and, its very short. 2 hours to beat. Kinda letdown.
Overall, good deal for a price.

â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜† Good! = [b]Portal[/b]

[h1]Puzzles[/h1]

The Cake is a lie, but the hype for this game is NOT. The beautiful Source engine is put to major use here as you navigate through a convoluted (and darkly hilarious) maze, the only reward being Delicious Cake and Grief Counseling.

GLaDOS is one of my favorite villains, using only psychological manipulation to harm you. This is one of those games that you are going to need your sound on for. The puzzles do seem simple at first glance, but many are much harder then one might imagine, and have many unthought of solutions. By using certain techniques you can prop open doors and even avoid killing companion cube (sadly, I couldn't find a way to take him with me...).

Great gameplay, great story, great game. 

â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜† Good! = [b]Portal Prelude[/b]

[h1]Puzzles[/h1]

It is an unofficial prequel to the game Portal, developed by an independent team of three. The game features a brand new storyline focusing on the pre-GLaDOS era of Aperture Science where test subjects are monitored by employees of the facility.

But you should be prepaired for this game. This game have much sadistic puzzles as other Portal games, I suggect you to play minimum Portal 1 (or better Portal 2 and Portal Stories: Mel) for better understandment how to "think with portals".

You guys might check this one out, this fanmade expansion is cost free.
